alert.note: Alert for Addison (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 14 at 2:32PM EDT until further notice by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Vermont... Otter Creek At Middlebury affecting Addison County. For the Otter Creek...including Middlebury...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Otter Creek at Middlebury. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Lowland field flooding begins south of Middlebury especially in the Seeley District. Water begins to overflow onto Creek Road and 3 Mile Bridge Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM EDT Friday the stage was around 6.5 feet and slowly rising. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 7.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then rise to 7.7 feet early Monday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.2 feet on 04/21/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 245 AM EDT.
